New Records: India ended a 13-year drought by winning the T20 World Cup.
Virat Kohli scored a half-century in his final T20 World Cup game and announced his retirement from the tournament.
Jasprit Bumrah was named Player of the Tournament for his exceptional bowling performance.
Key Match Events: The match was a nail-biter with India scoring 176 runs and South Africa 147.
Virat Kohli turned the game around after a slow start by India.
Jasprit Bumrah's bowling and Suryakumar Yadav's game-saving catch were pivotal moments.
South Africa came close but eventually fell short in their first World Cup final.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed pride in the team's resilience and achievement.
South Africa captain Aiden Markram was gutted but proud of the team's effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The article provided context on T20 cricket for new fans, explaining the format.
The win marked a significant milestone for India and a historical moment for South Africa.
